description: This table contains dispense information for orders.

columns.name: ORDER_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the order record.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE_REAL
columns.description: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.

columns.name: RX_TO_PHRM_DEA
columns.description: The transfer to pharmacy's Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) number captured during a prescription transfer. A DEA number is assigned by the Drug Enforcement Administration to providers to allow them to write prescriptions for controlled substances.

columns.name: RX_XFER_PHARMACY_ID
columns.description: Stores the pharmacy that performed the prescription transfer.

columns.name: RX_XFR_LAST_DISP_DT
columns.description: Date the prescription was last dispensed from the previous non-integrated pharmacy captured during a prescription transfer.

columns.name: RX_FROM_PHRM_DEA
columns.description: The transfer from pharmacy's Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) number captured during prescription transfer. A DEA number is assigned by the Drug Enforcement Administration to providers to allow them to write prescriptions for controlled substances.

columns.name: RX_BILL_GUAR_ACC_ID
columns.description: This item is used to contain the guarantor account ID to bill the remaining balance of the prescription if the patient will not be paying with cash.

columns.name: RX_BILL_HOSP_ACC_ID
columns.description: This item is used to contain the hospital account ID to bill the remaining balance of the prescription if the patient will not be paying with cash.

columns.name: PAT_PAY_AMOUNT_CALC
columns.description: When the prescription patient pay amount is overridden, this item is populated with the calculated patient pay amount. When the patient pay amount is not overridden, the calculated patient pay amount is stored in the patient pay amount (I ORD 47380). For cash prescriptions, the calculated patient pay amount is the cash price calculated by ambulatory pharmacy. For prescriptions using coverage, it's the patient pay amount determined by the processor.

columns.name: PAT_PAY_AMT_REAS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The reason why the user overrode the prescription patient pay amount.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: RX_XFR_FRST_DISP_DT
columns.description: The date the previous non-integrated pharmacy first dispensed the prescription to the patient.

columns.name: RX_FRM_PHR_ADDR
columns.description: A prescription can be transferred in from a non-integrated pharmacy that is not built in the system (a free-text pharmacy). That pharmacy's address can be entered during the transfer in and stored here.

columns.name: RX_TO_PHR_ADDR
columns.description: A prescription can be transferred out from an ambulatory pharmacy to a non-integrated pharmacy that is not built in the system (a free-text pharmacy). That pharmacy's address can be entered during the transfer out and stored here.

columns.name: CASH_PRICE_REAS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The reason the user overrode the cash price.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: RX_XFER_QTY_XFER
columns.description: This is the quantity that was transferred during a prescription transfer.

columns.name: RX_XFR_QTY_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description:
This is the unit associated with the quantity that was transferred during a prescription transfer.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: COMP_FILL_YN
columns.description:
Stores if this is a completion of a partial fill. For non-partial fills, it will always store a null. If this is a partial fill that does not complete the fill, then it will store a No. Otherwise, it will store a Yes.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: PAT_PAY_AMT_ESTIMAT
columns.description: The patient pay amount estimated for the patient when requesting the fill. For example, this displays to the patient when requesting fills on the web with their credit card. If no estimate is shown to the patient, nothing will be stored.

columns.name: PAT_PAY_AMT_POSTED
columns.description: The total amount paid by the patient for this order.

columns.name: PAT_PAY_AMT_APPRVD
columns.description: The maximum allowed amount to charge the patient. This is used if an estimated price is shown to the patient while requesting the fill. For example, if an estimated price was shown to the patient this would initially be the estimated price plus a buffer. If blank, there is no maximum.

columns.name: PRES_DISP_CUST_ID
columns.description: This item contains the government issued ID of the customer picking up the corresponding prescription fill.

columns.name: RX_FILL_DC_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the user who filled a discontinued prescription. Normally this user is a pharmacist.

columns.name: RX_BILL_PAYMENT_ID
columns.description: In table ORDER_DISP_INFO_2, the column RX_BILL_PAYMENT_ID (I ORD 47815) has been deprecated.  This column has been replaced by column RX_TAR_ID (I ORD 47816) in the table RX_ORDER_DISP_PAT_PMTS.  The deprecated column's data is no longer available because it is no longer populated in Chronicles.

columns.name: RX_REFILL_REQ_SER_ID
columns.description: This item stores the recipient the refill authorization request was sent to. This item might be empty if the request was sent directly to a pool or a free text provider.

columns.name: PROD_EXP_DATE
columns.description: This item tracks the expiration date of the product, which is the date on which the drug needs to be discarded due to spoilage.

columns.name: RX_ACTIVE_PHR_ID
columns.description: The pharmacy that is currently processing this fill request.

columns.name: CONTINUE_FILL_ON_DC_DTTM
columns.description: This item stores the most recent instant the continuation of the fill on a reordered prescription was approved.

columns.name: FILL_DAY_SUP_THPY
columns.description: This item stores the number of days that the patient will be taking the medication that was dispensed.

columns.name: RX_PART_FILL_PAT_CHARG
columns.description: Stores the partial fill patient pay amount at the time of dispense, if the partial was reversed after it was dispensed for the rebilling on completion fill.

columns.name: RX_TRANSITION_OVRIDE_STAT_C_NAME
columns.description:
This item stores whether or not a medication transition in place for the prescription has been overridden on the fill-level.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Not Overridden


Transition Deferred


Transition Rejected

columns.name: RX_TRANSITION_OVRIDE_RSN_C_NAME
columns.description:
This item stores the reason that the medication transition was overridden on the fill-level.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Transition Added


Patient Requested


Provider Requested


Transition Completed


Prescription Reordered


Fill Already In Progress

columns.name: RX_TRANSITION_OVRIDE_CMT
columns.description: This item stores a free-text comment explaining why the medication transition was overridden on the fill-level.

columns.name: RX_TRANSITION_OVRIDE_USR_ID
columns.description: This item stores the user that overrode the medication transition on a fill-level.

columns.name: RX_TRANSITION_OVRIDE_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: This item stores the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) instant that the user overrode the medication transition.

columns.name: OTH_PAY_COV_AMT
columns.description: The total dollar amount of any payment from another source including coupons.

columns.name: PAT_PAY_CHA_APPROVE
columns.description: When the Patient Charge Amount Changed flag is acknowledged by the user, this will store what Patient Charge (ORD 47380) amount they approved. It is used to make sure we don't re-add the flag unless the Patient Charge amount differs from this value.
